analysis_metadata.analysis_type: ULTRATHINK - Comprehensive E2E Timing Pattern Analysis
analysis_metadata.scope: Complete E2E test suite timing patterns

wait_for_timeout_analysis.context: After demo button click - waiting for React state propagation
wait_for_timeout_analysis.recommended_replacement: await page.waitForLoadState('domcontentloaded') or await page.locator('[data-testid="matrix-container"]').waitFor({ state: 'attached', timeout: 2000 })
wait_for_timeout_analysis.reason: Demo button triggers state update, but we should wait for specific UI change rather than arbitrary timeout. Already followed by networkidle wait, so this 500ms is likely redundant.
wait_for_timeout_analysis.flakiness_risk: LOW - Already has networkidle wait following
wait_for_timeout_analysis.impact_scope: ALL_TESTS - Used in AuthHelper.loginAsTestUser()

wait_for_timeout_analysis.context: After 'Access Matrix' button click
wait_for_timeout_analysis.purpose: Wait for matrix to load after project access
wait_for_timeout_analysis.reason: Immediately after this timeout, code checks if matrix is visible with a 3s timeout. The 1s arbitrary wait should be replaced with the actual check.
wait_for_timeout_analysis.flakiness_risk: MEDIUM - If matrix loads in <1s, we waste time. If >1s, we may fail.
wait_for_timeout_analysis.impact_scope: HIGH - Used in ensureProjectExists() called by all tests

wait_for_timeout_analysis.context: After Manual Setup button click - waiting for modal
wait_for_timeout_analysis.reason: Modal appearance should be detected by waiting for the input field to be visible, not arbitrary timeout.
wait_for_timeout_analysis.flakiness_risk: MEDIUM - Modal may take >500ms to animate in slow CI environments
wait_for_timeout_analysis.impact_scope: HIGH - Used in ensureProjectExists() fallback path

wait_for_timeout_analysis.context: After delete button click in IdeaHelper.deleteIdea()
wait_for_timeout_analysis.reason: Should wait for the element to be removed from DOM rather than arbitrary delay.
wait_for_timeout_analysis.flakiness_risk: HIGH - If deletion takes >100ms, subsequent operations may fail
wait_for_timeout_analysis.impact_scope: MEDIUM - Used in delete operations

wait_for_timeout_analysis.context: After collapse button click in IdeaHelper.collapseIdea()
wait_for_timeout_analysis.recommended_replacement: await card.waitFor({ state: 'stable', timeout: 1000 }) or check for 'is-collapsed' class
wait_for_timeout_analysis.reason: Should wait for animation to complete by checking element state or class rather than arbitrary timeout.
wait_for_timeout_analysis.impact_scope: LOW - Only used in collapse/expand operations

wait_for_timeout_analysis.context: After expand button click in IdeaHelper.expandIdea()
wait_for_timeout_analysis.reason: Should wait for the details content to become visible rather than arbitrary timeout.
wait_for_timeout_analysis.impact_scope: LOW - Only used in collapse/expand operations

wait_for_timeout_analysis.context: After drag operation in MatrixHelper.dragIdeaToQuadrant()
wait_for_timeout_analysis.purpose: Wait for drag animation to settle
wait_for_timeout_analysis.recommended_replacement: await page.waitForFunction(() => { const card = document.querySelector(...); return !card.matches('.is-dragging'); }, { timeout: 2000 })
wait_for_timeout_analysis.reason: Drag operations should wait for dragging state to clear and position to stabilize rather than arbitrary timeout. This is critical for subsequent assertions.
wait_for_timeout_analysis.flakiness_risk: HIGH - Drag animation timing varies significantly across browsers and CI environments
wait_for_timeout_analysis.impact_scope: CRITICAL - Used in ALL drag/drop tests

wait_for_timeout_analysis.context: After drag to coordinates in MatrixHelper.dragIdeaToCoordinates()
wait_for_timeout_analysis.purpose: Wait for drag animation to settle
wait_for_timeout_analysis.reason: Should wait for all CSS animations/transitions to complete rather than arbitrary timeout.
wait_for_timeout_analysis.flakiness_risk: HIGH - Critical for drag operation stability
wait_for_timeout_analysis.impact_scope: HIGH - Used in coordinate-based drag tests

wait_for_timeout_analysis.context: After hovering quadrant label in MatrixHelper.hoverQuadrantLabel()
wait_for_timeout_analysis.recommended_replacement: Remove - hover effects are immediate, no wait needed
wait_for_timeout_analysis.reason: Hover effects apply immediately. If testing tooltip appearance, wait for tooltip element specifically.
wait_for_timeout_analysis.impact_scope: LOW - Only used in hover tests

wait_for_timeout_analysis.context: Between keyboard presses in AccessibilityHelper.simulateKeyboardDrag()
wait_for_timeout_analysis.purpose: Delay between arrow key presses for keyboard navigation
wait_for_timeout_analysis.recommended_replacement: Reduce to 50ms or await element position change
wait_for_timeout_analysis.reason: 100ms between each key press may be excessive. Could reduce to 50ms or wait for position update.
wait_for_timeout_analysis.impact_scope: LOW - Only used in accessibility keyboard navigation tests

wait_for_timeout_analysis.context: waitForAnimation() utility function
wait_for_timeout_analysis.recommended_replacement: Replace all calls to this function with specific element state waits or animation completion checks
wait_for_timeout_analysis.reason: This is a convenience function that encourages arbitrary waits. Should be removed and replaced with state-based waits at call sites.
wait_for_timeout_analysis.flakiness_risk: HIGH - Used throughout tests as a catch-all delay
wait_for_timeout_analysis.impact_scope: CRITICAL - Anti-pattern used across multiple tests

wait_for_timeout_analysis.context: After project card click in selectProject()
wait_for_timeout_analysis.reason: Should wait for specific UI element indicating project loaded rather than arbitrary timeout.
wait_for_timeout_analysis.flakiness_risk: MEDIUM - Project load time varies with project complexity
wait_for_timeout_analysis.impact_scope: MEDIUM - Used in project selection flow

wait_for_timeout_analysis.context: After project deletion in deleteProject()
wait_for_timeout_analysis.purpose: Wait for project to be removed
wait_for_timeout_analysis.reason: Should wait for project card to be removed from DOM rather than arbitrary timeout.
wait_for_timeout_analysis.flakiness_risk: HIGH - Deletion may take longer than 1s in some cases
wait_for_timeout_analysis.impact_scope: MEDIUM - Used in project cleanup

wait_for_timeout_analysis.context: After search input in searchProjects() - debounce wait
wait_for_timeout_analysis.recommended_replacement: await this.page.waitForFunction(() => !document.querySelector('.search-loading'), { timeout: 2000 }) or reduce to 300ms (typical debounce)
wait_for_timeout_analysis.reason: Search debounce is typically 250-300ms. 500ms is overly conservative. Better to wait for search results to update.
wait_for_timeout_analysis.impact_scope: LOW - Only used in search tests

wait_for_timeout_analysis.context: After page.goto('/') in authenticateUser() helper
wait_for_timeout_analysis.recommended_replacement: Remove - already have waitForLoadState('networkidle') on line 33
wait_for_timeout_analysis.reason: Duplicate wait. Line 33 already has waitForLoadState('networkidle') which is sufficient.
wait_for_timeout_analysis.impact_scope: HIGH - Used in all AI file analysis tests

wait_for_timeout_analysis.context: After demo button click in authenticateUser()
wait_for_timeout_analysis.purpose: Wait for demo authentication to complete
wait_for_timeout_analysis.recommended_replacement: await page.waitForLoadState('networkidle') or await page.locator('[data-testid="upload-button"]').waitFor({ state: 'visible', timeout: 5000 })
wait_for_timeout_analysis.reason: Should wait for specific UI element indicating auth success rather than arbitrary 2s timeout.
wait_for_timeout_analysis.impact_scope: HIGH - Used in all AI file analysis tests

wait_for_timeout_analysis.context: After file input selection
wait_for_timeout_analysis.purpose: Wait for file to be processed
wait_for_timeout_analysis.reason: Should wait for file selection confirmation UI rather than arbitrary timeout.
wait_for_timeout_analysis.impact_scope: HIGH - Used in multiple file upload tests

wait_for_timeout_analysis.context: Inside route handler - simulating upload delay
wait_for_timeout_analysis.recommended_replacement: N/A - This is intentional test delay to simulate slow upload
wait_for_timeout_analysis.reason: This is a deliberate delay in the route mock to test upload progress UI. Not optimizable.
wait_for_timeout_analysis.impact_scope: SINGLE_TEST - Progress indicator test only

wait_for_timeout_analysis.context: Inside route handler - simulating analysis delay
wait_for_timeout_analysis.purpose: Mock network delay for AI analysis
wait_for_timeout_analysis.recommended_replacement: N/A - This is intentional test delay
wait_for_timeout_analysis.reason: Deliberate delay to test loading state UI. Not optimizable.
wait_for_timeout_analysis.impact_scope: SINGLE_TEST - Loading state test only

wait_for_timeout_analysis.context: After file upload to check for analyzing indicator
wait_for_timeout_analysis.recommended_replacement: Remove - next line already waits for analyzing indicator with timeout
wait_for_timeout_analysis.reason: Line 247 checks for analyzing indicator with isVisible() which has its own wait logic.
wait_for_timeout_analysis.impact_scope: SINGLE_TEST

wait_for_timeout_analysis.context: After file upload - waiting for analysis results
wait_for_timeout_analysis.purpose: Wait for AI analysis to complete
wait_for_timeout_analysis.reason: Should wait for analysis results element to appear rather than arbitrary 3s. AI analysis may take variable time.
wait_for_timeout_analysis.flakiness_risk: HIGH - Analysis time highly variable, may timeout
wait_for_timeout_analysis.impact_scope: HIGH - Pattern repeated in many AI tests

wait_for_timeout_analysis.context: First file upload in caching test
wait_for_timeout_analysis.purpose: Wait for first analysis to complete and cache
wait_for_timeout_analysis.reason: Should wait for analysis completion indicator.
wait_for_timeout_analysis.impact_scope: SINGLE_TEST - Caching test

wait_for_timeout_analysis.context: Second file upload in caching test
wait_for_timeout_analysis.purpose: Wait for cached result to load
wait_for_timeout_analysis.reason: Cached results should load faster than fresh analysis, but still need to wait for UI update.
wait_for_timeout_analysis.impact_scope: SINGLE_TEST

wait_for_timeout_analysis.context: Image upload - waiting for GPT-4V analysis
wait_for_timeout_analysis.purpose: Wait for image analysis to complete
wait_for_timeout_analysis.reason: Image analysis via GPT-4V can be slower than text. Should wait for specific completion indicator with longer timeout.
wait_for_timeout_analysis.flakiness_risk: VERY_HIGH - Image analysis time highly variable
wait_for_timeout_analysis.impact_scope: MEDIUM - All image analysis tests

wait_for_timeout_analysis.context: Image OCR extraction test
wait_for_timeout_analysis.reason: OCR processing can be slow. Should wait for extraction completion indicator.
wait_for_timeout_analysis.impact_scope: MEDIUM - OCR tests

wait_for_timeout_analysis.context: Audio upload - waiting for Whisper transcription
wait_for_timeout_analysis.reason: Audio transcription can be very slow depending on audio length. Need longer timeout and specific wait.
wait_for_timeout_analysis.flakiness_risk: CRITICAL - Audio transcription time extremely variable based on audio length
wait_for_timeout_analysis.impact_scope: HIGH - All audio analysis tests

wait_for_timeout_analysis.context: Audio quality indicator check
wait_for_timeout_analysis.reason: Quality analysis happens after transcription. Should wait for specific indicator.
wait_for_timeout_analysis.impact_scope: MEDIUM

wait_for_timeout_analysis.context: PDF upload - waiting for document analysis
wait_for_timeout_analysis.reason: PDF analysis time depends on document length and complexity.
wait_for_timeout_analysis.impact_scope: HIGH - All PDF analysis tests

wait_for_timeout_analysis.context: File type indicator check
wait_for_timeout_analysis.reason: File type detection should be instant. Wait for specific UI element.
wait_for_timeout_analysis.impact_scope: LOW

wait_for_loadstate_analysis.reason: Authentication doesn't require all network requests to complete. DOM ready is sufficient for auth check.
wait_for_loadstate_analysis.impact_scope: CRITICAL - Used in ALL tests via loginAsTestUser()

wait_for_loadstate_analysis.reason: After demo button click, we only need DOM to be ready to check for auth indicators. Network idle is excessive.
wait_for_loadstate_analysis.context: After demo button click in auth flow

wait_for_loadstate_analysis.reason: After localStorage reload for auth, only need DOM ready to verify auth state.
After localStorage change and reload, DOM ready is sufficient.
Initial page load for auth - DOM ready sufficient.
wait_for_loadstate_analysis.impact_scope: MEDIUM - Used in idea journey tests

wait_for_loadstate_analysis.reason: After demo button navigation, DOM ready is sufficient.
Cross-browser title check - DOM ready sufficient.
wait_for_loadstate_analysis.impact_scope: HIGH - Used in ALL cross-browser tests (12 occurrences)

wait_for_loadstate_analysis.reason: Performance test specifically measuring network performance - networkidle is correct here.
wait_for_loadstate_analysis.impact_scope: APPROPRIATE - Performance benchmarks need network idle

wait_for_selector_analysis.recommended_optimization: Good pattern - consider reducing timeout to 5s if matrix consistently loads faster
wait_for_selector_analysis.flakiness_risk: LOW - Explicit state check is good
wait_for_selector_analysis.context: ensureProjectExists() - waiting for matrix after project creation

wait_for_selector_analysis.recommended_optimization: Good pattern - explicit timeout recommended: { state: 'visible', timeout: 5000 }

wait_for_selector_analysis.impact_scope: HIGH - Used in all idea creation

wait_for_selector_analysis.recommended_optimization: 30s timeout is excessive. Reduce to 10s: { timeout: 10000 }

implicit_waits_analysis.recommendation: Good pattern - using try-catch for optional checks

implicit_waits_analysis.purpose: Auth indicator checks with long timeout
implicit_waits_analysis.recommendation: 8s timeout is very long for parallel checks. Consider reducing to 5s.
Good pattern - explicit state and timeout

flakiness_risks.risk_description: Using waitForTimeout before checking element state creates race condition. If operation completes faster, we waste time. If slower, we may fail.
flakiness_risks.recommended_fix: Replace with direct state-based waits or waitForFunction
examples: test-helpers.ts:164 - 1s wait then check if matrix visible
ai-file-analysis-journey.spec.ts:261 - 3s wait then check for analysis results

flakiness_risks.pattern: networkidle for operations that don't need it
flakiness_risks.risk_description: Using networkidle when only DOM ready is needed wastes 1-3 seconds per call and can cause flakiness if background requests are ongoing.
flakiness_risks.recommended_fix: Use domcontentloaded for auth, navigation, and UI state checks. Reserve networkidle only for performance tests.
examples: test-helpers.ts:102 - Auth check only needs DOM

flakiness_risks.risk_description: 300ms fixed wait after drag operations is a timing assumption. Drag performance varies significantly across browsers and CI environments.
flakiness_risks.recommended_fix: Wait for dragging state to clear using waitForFunction or check element.matches('.is-dragging')

flakiness_risks.risk_description: AI operations (GPT-4V, Whisper, document analysis) have highly variable execution times. Fixed 3s timeouts will cause frequent test failures.
flakiness_risks.recommended_fix: Wait for completion indicators with generous timeouts (15-30s) rather than arbitrary waits

flakiness_risks.risk_description: Some tests perform actions then immediately assert without waiting for state updates
flakiness_risks.recommended_fix: Add explicit waits for element state changes before assertions
examples: idea-crud-journey.spec.ts:389 - Check dragging class without waiting for drag start

performance_bottlenecks.issue: Excessive networkidle usage in auth flow
performance_bottlenecks.recommended_fix: Replace networkidle with domcontentloaded in auth helpers (lines 102, 118, 126 in test-helpers.ts)

performance_bottlenecks.issue: Redundant waits in AI file analysis
performance_bottlenecks.recommended_fix: Remove redundant waitForTimeout before checks that have their own wait logic
Replace 300ms fixed wait with animation completion detection
Reduce TEST_TIMEOUT from 30s to 10s for most operations. Use 30s only for complex workflows.
performance_bottlenecks.estimated_savings: No direct time savings, but faster failure feedback

performance_bottlenecks.recommended_fix: Run auth indicator checks in parallel with Promise.race() or reduce individual timeouts to 3s
Remove 100ms wait after hover - hover effects are instantaneous

priority_fixes.title: Replace networkidle with domcontentloaded in auth flow
priority_fixes.estimated_impact: Affects ALL tests - saves ~60 seconds per full run

priority_fixes.title: Replace drag operation arbitrary waits with state checks
priority_fixes.estimated_impact: All drag/drop tests - saves ~10 seconds, eliminates critical flakiness risk

priority_fixes.title: Remove redundant waits before element checks in AI tests
priority_fixes.estimated_impact: AI test suite - saves ~30 seconds, eliminates redundancy
priority_fixes.implementation: Remove waitForTimeout calls that precede element visibility checks

priority_fixes.title: Replace AI operation arbitrary waits with completion checks
priority_fixes.estimated_impact: AI tests - saves ~25 seconds, eliminates critical flakiness

priority_fixes.title: Remove waitForAnimation utility and replace call sites
priority_fixes.estimated_impact: Eliminates anti-pattern that encourages arbitrary waits
priority_fixes.implementation: Remove function, replace each call with specific state-based wait or animation completion check

recommended_constants_update.rationale: Current constants encourage arbitrary waits. New constants provide guidance for appropriate timeout values while discouraging fixed delays.

test_patterns_to_establish.example:
await element.waitFor({ state: 'visible', timeout: 5000 }) // GOOD
await page.waitForTimeout(1000) // BAD
test_patterns_to_establish.benefit: Eliminates timing assumptions, runs as fast as possible, more reliable
Wait for actual animation completion rather than arbitrary delay
Use minimal wait level needed, saves 1-3s per page load

test_patterns_to_establish.example:
// AI operations with generous but not infinite timeout
await page.locator('.analysis-complete').waitFor({ state: 'visible', timeout: 20000 })
test_patterns_to_establish.benefit: Accommodates variable execution time while preventing indefinite hangs
Eliminate unnecessary waits that slow tests without adding value

critical_issues_requiring_immediate_atte.issue: AI test flakiness due to arbitrary timeouts
critical_issues_requiring_immediate_atte.affected_tests: All AI file analysis and generation tests
critical_issues_requiring_immediate_atte.recommendation: Replace all AI operation waitForTimeout with completion indicator waits with 15-30s timeouts
Implement drag state completion detection instead of 300ms fixed wait

critical_issues_requiring_immediate_atte.issue: networkidle overuse causing slow test runs
critical_issues_requiring_immediate_atte.failure_rate_estimate: Not causing failures, but adding 60+ seconds per run
critical_issues_requiring_immediate_atte.recommendation: Audit all networkidle usage and replace with domcontentloaded where appropriate

next_steps.estimated_impact: 60 second reduction per full run, affects all tests

next_steps.action: Implement Priority Fix #3 (Remove redundant AI test waits)
Implement Priority Fix #4 (AI operation completion checks)
next_steps.estimated_impact: Eliminates critical flakiness in AI tests

next_steps.action: Implement Priority Fix #2 (Drag state completion detection)
Update constants file with recommended values
next_steps.estimated_impact: Guides future test development toward better patterns

metrics_summary.maintainability_improvement: Elimination of timing assumptions makes tests more reliable across environments
